ObjectClass.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Relationship Limb Other Edema
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.:A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.
